snippet: Various groups are vying for the wood that once made up the Rockaway Boardwalk so they can recycle or transform it into other products as a way to generate local revenue.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy destroyed much of the Rockaway Boardwalk in Queens, and various groups from around the city are laying claim to the leftover wood, to be recycled or transformed into products that could generate local revenue; groups fear that government agencies seem to be discarding usable materials in their rush to make the area habitable.
lead_paragraph: Various groups are vying for the wood that once made up the Rockaway Boardwalk so they can recycle or transform it into other products as a way to generate local revenue.

headline.seo: Rivals Vie for Wood From Storm-Torn Rockaway Boardwalk
headline.main: Clash Over Future of Wood From the Storm-Torn Rockaway Boardwalk
headline.print_headline: Clash Over Future of Wood From the Storm-Torn Rockaway Boardwalk
